history.content:
Do you like lasers but have no clue how they work??
Come take our DeCal: “Lasers for Everyone”!
We are a group of physics students that designed this course because we realized how much lasers show up in everyday life but not everyone has a grasp on how they work. They are such an integral part of so many pieces of equipment such as medical devices, rocket ships, fiber optics, and the list goes on!
We will cover the mechanisms behind lasers, how they were first developed, and their historical and practical uses. Finally, we will study contemporary work and applications of lasers. At the end we will look at lasers in the media and discuss the relevant physics.
The course is 1 unit and low workload so please do not worry about having to do too much extra work! We do not require any preliminary math or physics knowledge. It is also first come first serve.
Enrollment information:
Course Name: Physics 98_002 (make sure to enroll in group 002!!)
Course Number: 27192
For more information check out: https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/5736 or contact us at laserdecal2021@gmail.com
history.subject: Lasers for Everyone DeCal
